sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken arrives in Beijing with the hope of improving dialogue and preventing conflict with China.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Flying in from Ukraine, seven African leaders meet with President Putin in Russia in what they say is a peace mission.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken arrived in Beijing on Sunday at the start of a high-stakes mission to cool soaring tensions between the two world powers.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Blinken becomes the first American Secretary of State to visit China in nearly five years.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The world's two largest economies have been at odds on an array of issues, from trade to technology and regional security.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Blinken was originally scheduled to visit in February, but abruptly scrapped his plans as the United States protested and later shot down what it said was a Chinese spy balloon flying over its soil.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: South African President Cyril Ramaphosa met with Russian President Vladimir Putin on Saturday, telling him the war must end in Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Ramaphosa is part of a seven-leader African delegation that's now talked with both Putin and Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelensky in what it says is a peace mission. Putin said Russia is not giving up on negotiations with Ukraine. We welcome the balanced approach of African friends in the context of the Ukrainian crisis.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Dear friends, we appreciate your interest in the search for ways to regulate the conflict.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: We immediately responded positively to your proposal to hold a negotiation on the Ukrainian problem.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: African states are divided over whether Russia should be condemned for invading Ukraine, and there are questions as to whether South Africa is a neutral party.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The United States is accused of sending arms to Russia by ship from Cape Town in December.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The bodies of 38 students and three others were found burned, shot or hacked to death

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: at Lubiriya Secondary School in the border town of Mapondwe. The local mayor, Silvestre Mapose, told the Associated Press that some of the students were burnt to death when the rebels set fire to their dormitory, whilst others were shot or hacked with machetes. The authorities have blamed the allied democratic forces, a shadowy extremist group with ties to the Islamic State, which has been launching attacks for years from bases in neighboring Democratic Republic of Congo.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: At least six people were abducted by the rebels, who fled across the porous border, according to the Ugandan military.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Troops are now pursuing them to rescue the abducted students who were forced to carry looted food towards Congo's Varunga National Park, the military said.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: carry looted food towards Congo's Varunga National Park, the military said. Calls for the resignation of President Aleksandar Vucic rang through the Serbian capital Belgrade

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: on Saturday as protesters rallied for a seventh consecutive week.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The protests initially erupted after two back-to-back mass shootings in early May, with people accusing the government of promoting a culture of violence.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Euronews Serbia correspondent Maja Popovic was on the ground in Belgrade.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Serbian people went to the streets for the seventh time with the same demands.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: First of all, resignation of the police minister, resignation of the director of the National Security Information Agency.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Also, they want for two television networks to lose their license because they promote violence in Serbia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: This time, except of the capital city, except of the Belgrade, we have protested Serbia against violence also in the other cities like Novi Sad, Niš and Tragujevac.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: For Jura News, Maja Popovic from Belgrade.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: For Euronews, Maja Popovic from Belgrade.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Police in south eastern France clashed with protesters seeking to stop the construction of a new high speed train link with Italy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Figures vary about the exact number depending on the source, but between 3,000 to 4,000 protesters turned up close to the village of Saint-Rémy-de-Maurienne in Savoie in defiance of an official ban on the gathering.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Demonstrators also stormed the nearby railway line, although train traffic had been halted due to the situation in the early afternoon, according to the French operator SNCF.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Costing around 26 billion euros, the new line should eventually link France's Lyon and Turin in Italy, with a 57.5-kilometre tunnel through the Alps.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Backed by the European Union, supporters say it will greatly ease freight road traffic.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Both opponents say the ecological damage risks being devastating and that springs are already starting to dry up due to the works.
